blog.name: prayingmantisblade
blog.title: See you later Rockerboy
blog.description: A blog for all things Cyberpunk (2077)

title: THINGS I WANT IN CP2077 #1
body:
I know they’re not gonna do a class system, which I am in favor of, but PLEASE let me be a rockerboy!!

Let V show their despair and anger at a city that doesn’t give a shit through raw lyrics and loud electric guitar riffs! Make it possible to jam with companions in between missions!

PLEASE GDPR, make my anarchist punkrocker a reality!!

blog.description: Are you obsessed with a fandom, show, movie, or book?  Then you are at the right place!

title: Cyberpunk 2077 Gameplay Demo
body:
Have you checked out all the little detail in Cyberpunk 2077?

There had been a lack of information of Cyberpunk 2077 after the initial trailer release at E3. A few screenshots here or there but nothing beyond that and there certainly wasn’t game play release which is kind of important. That has luckily been rectified though with the release of a 45 minute gameplay release that shows off a lot of what the game will be.

Image via GameSpot

I was incredibly…

View On WordPress

Well this is my blog. Nothing really new about it...

22 | Australian | trans female

She/Her | HRT: 9 Aug 2017

This is my personal blog for my interests.

summary: So, quite obviously I made a post recently about a particular video game, Cyberpunk 2077 and a potential issue I could see...
body:
So, quite obviously I made a post recently about a particular video game, Cyberpunk 2077 and a potential issue I could see arising for said game, observations which I based upon a couple of interviews and the games trailer from earlier this year. I bounced this off a transphobic joke made by the game’s twitter just as a sort of starting point.

Now needless to say, these were pretty early observations on what ‘could’ be happening, I didn’t believe anything would be quite indicative of the final product and in fact, upon seeing the gameplay footage my hope and interest in Cyberpunk 2077 are very much improved and my understanding of the game has changed. This happened after seeing a particular scene referenced by one of the interviews I mention above after which I now find that the interpretation to be read from that scene is very very different to the interpretation of the scene provided in the interview. As such my outlook is has changed.

However, it soon became pretty clear that people weren’t able to recognise the nuance of critique or observation and took my post pretty far. I am still getting, even now, a great deal of comments and asks full of vitriol and rage from people offended that someone might have an opinion on something. They began to accuse me of being overly offended, or even outraged at the game, where it should have been clear I was only somewhat wary, addressing potential issues that weren’t even definite. At worst I got messages referring to me by a wide number of violent homophobic, transphobic, and even racist/antisemitic slurs (despite their being no indication I’m even Jewish..?)

Now, this outrage over my post was clearly blown way out of proportion, (though that’s no surprise considering some of them seemed largely offended by me just being trans or something,) and was not at all an understandable reaction. But amongst all of these comments I got some that largely confused me that essentially went like this:

“Hah, get wrekt sjw cuck, I’m just more likely to buy this game now along with Doom: Eternal and Red Dead 2 knowing that these all trigger you lol!!”

Now, despite how immature and reactionary these comments are they confused me… because I’ve seen absolutely no outrage over Doom or Red Dead from leftist communities. I really should have had they existed, I’m pretty leftist. Turns out, the outrage doesn’t exist. It simply isn’t there. It was constructed out of nothing so that reactionary conservatives can continue to create this idea of the 'SJW’ enemy or something for them to get angry and (rather ironically) offended about.

Thanks to Shaun’s video above I had this cleared up for me. In fact, it’s funny to see that my interpretation of the modern Doom franchise is clear to others as well, of a franchise that’s actually fairly anti-corporation/-capitalist in it’s message and critique, as it’s looking Cyberpunk 2077 actually will be too. Funnily enough, that’s a fairly leftist position. Hope y'all racists and reactionaries who buy that game can stomach that lol.

Makes me think of all the other series that are predominantly progressive or left-leaning in message: Dead Space, Wolfenstein, Battlefield and Call of Duty sometimes, Alien: Isolation, Horizon: Zero Dawn, The Last of Us, Uncharted, and even Crash Bandicoot, Metal Gear Solid, Deus Ex, and so many more that I can’t list off the top of my head….

summary: El juego más esperado de City Project Red abre sus puertas a consumidores con el video gameplay de Cyberpunk 2077. Durante tres...
caption:
El juego más esperado de City Project Red abre sus puertas a consumidores con el video gameplay de Cyberpunk 2077.

Durante tres días, después de una gran cantidad de publicidad extraña y de juegos ARGs, este domingo 26 de agosto se presentó en la plataforma de twitch el video gameplay de Cyberpunk 2077, con las primeras impresiones de cómo funcionara el mundo, personalización de personajes y el funcionamiento RPG que se presenta.

Daniel Blanco, gamer y fan de City Project Red, opina: “ellos se dedican a Rpg, si, y obviamente es Rpg. este juego, pero nunca habían, nunca se habían metido al área de primera persona y menos de disparos, se me hace muy interesante que aparte de haber hecho ese cambio sigan manteniendo como su, como el olor por así decirlo y se siga viendo que es un juego de ellos en un mundo muchísimo más grande y más dinámico que The Witcher”

El juego sigue en una espera de lanzamiento y aunque el motor gráfico puede ser pesado para esta generación de consolas, ellos afirman que, si lo soporta, pero lo lanzaran cuando esté terminado.

summary: Really interested to find out how Jackie and V met. Cause he seems to genuinely be V's friend and not an opportunistic partner
question: Really interested to find out how Jackie and V met. Cause he seems to genuinely be V's friend and not an opportunistic partner
answer:
I really hope they were friends from their background or something. If not then maybe they are the first person in Night City who they met and got along with and had each other’s back.

Sort of like how Boss and Gatt were best mates in Saints Row 1. Or Boss and Shaundie in Saints Row 2.

blog.description: 26. VA. Gaming since '97 Reviews, some thoughts on current events, a meme or two, maybe even gameplay PSN Chayk-47

title: Cyberpunk gameplay thots
body:
Obviously, this is a vertical slice of the game, something where CDPR can show off how the game works while making sure nothing is stressed too hard or explored too deeply. That being said, sonofabitch what a way to present your game. I’m going to gloss over my favorite parts and things I noticed because honestly, a play by play won’t do it justice. Please go watch it.

MadWorld (or “City” in this case)

I don’t need the sprawling landscapes and varied vistas of The Witcher 3. CDPR did an incredible job making every acre feel lived in. The landscape of Night City allows them to hone the focus of detail on a singular city. The touch of every NPCs class or sect hanging over their heads is nice, but I look forward to turning that option off and just enjoying the crowded streets for what they are. Gorgeous. The level of detail presented was just staggering, I couldn’t look at one thing for too long or I’d miss something. The lighting is sharp and accentuates how the world sits between impoverished dirty and futuristic shine. Even the ‘natural’ lighting in the apartment gunfight really cuts through and actually is worth noticing when LEDs and neon lights are almost all we get down on street level. The rooms are very well detailed, looking lived in, the clutter is not just assets but seemingly hand-picked to a certain extent. Night City is somehow seedy and luxurious, something made clear with every area we visited in the demo. 

RPGesus Christ

I can only imagine this had to have somewhat silenced the “it’s gonna be a FPS, not an RPG” crowd. Everything from the guns, the gear, and even the biometrics to some degree (that humanity cost tho). It really looks like it feels like a tabletop game especially when you get to the character creator. When V goes to pick up the pistol in her apartment, the green bar (to me at least) indicates a rarity level. Especially when later in the video another gun is seen with a purple bar.  Loot was an aspect of gameplay I didn’t foresee at all. I thought it’d be a merchant system. Loot, however, makes things a bit more interesting in my opinion. The ability to find something out in the world as opposed to coming to a market every time is always more immersive and overall fun in my opinion. The dialogue options are interesting and often, which is exactly as it should be. I’m not sure if this was intended but V even interrupts the Corpo woman and you can actually see a physical reaction though brief. Which has really interesting implications if used properly. It didn’t seem like the “shut up” button you’re given in Fallout that just silences the NPC. This actually seemed to be an active decision the player makes that the other character actually observes or at least understands. 

Movement Overhaul is Very Enticing

Doom Eternal is the closest thing I can think of when I see such quick and nimble movements from a character in an FP game. A sense of control and dynamism that will allow and encourage those to play as they wish. Dashing, sliding, and sticking to walls with mantis blades; all of it will only be enhanced with what appears to be well-designed levels and environments. I wasn’t sure if I’d talk about this in the movement section or the world section but to me; this specific demo shows how these parts of the level (and hopefully others) seek to facilitate combat. Not just exist in the same space to build the world or just because.

Guns and Their Play

We only saw four guns and one melee weapon, a handgun, the bullet curving submachine gun, a double barrel shotgun, some kind of gauss rifle, and the signature mantis blades. Both were very interesting in their functions. Enemies appear a little spongey, but I’m willing to chalk it up to augmentations but I do hope it gets a touched up a bit. None of that Division shit, I cannot stand that. No one has to go down in one shot but once I’m half a mag in…maybe they should be dead…? Later in the demo you do see the double barrel put people down left and right as well as the bullet curving gun. It’s a step up from the Titanfall pistol and an idea that lets you kind of peek behind the curtain as to what kind of tech we’ll be dealing with. The rifle shown is also again, very cool and makes me wonder what other high-concept weaponry is in store. I can’t comment on the feel obviously but I hope that the guns feel heavy to kind of play off how quick your character is/ can be. 

Deliberate Dialogue 

I very much enjoyed the ‘buddy-cop’ conversations between V and Jackie. I’m getting shallow but purposeful bits, most likely to avoid spoilers and things of that sort. Nothing too significant but it’s very well voice acted and that drives the tense moments and lets the lighter ones land regardless of how ‘deep’ the writing is. Then there's the Maelstrom scene, V and Jackie have a chat with a fine gentleman by the name of DumDum. The performance is phenomenal. The writing is good and houses the cliche dick measuring contest between DumDum and Jackie. It’s how Dum Dum carries himself and speaks that made me believe we had found the boss of the Maelstroms. Only for the big bearded fuck to storm in and start questioning what’s going on. Long story short, everyone dies and Dum Dum was nothing more than a passerby, practically an NPC in the open world. I was impressed how in that one scene, an absolute no one could leave such an impression on me. That doesn’t happen in most games, not for me at least. If this is something I can expect from even a handful of NPCs I’ll be floored and beside myself.

I know I’m fanboying but let me enjoy something dammit!!
